channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Intel will start making GPUs, a market dominated by Nvidia
item.description: Intel has been bulking up a team to focus on this effort and will develop its GPU strategy around customer needs.

item.title: TikTok recovers from dip in usage that benefited rival apps following U.S. ownership change
item.description: TikTok usage dropped following ownership change, benefiting rival apps. But now, its numbers are climbing again.

item.title: Fitbit founders launch AI platform to help families monitor their health
item.description: Luffu uses AI in the background to gather and organize family information, learn day-to-day patterns, and flag notable changes so families can stay al...

item.title: PayPal hires HP’s Enrique Lores as its new CEO
item.description: PayPal is appointing CFO and COO Jamie Miller as interim CEO until March 1.

item.title: 2026 plans: What’s next for Startup Battlefield 200
item.description: See what to expect for Startup Battlefield 200 in 2026, the ultimate startup pitch competition on the global stage at TechCrunch Disrupt. Join the mai...

item.title: Peak XV says internal disagreement led to partner exits as it doubles down on AI
item.description: Peak XV is transitioning board roles and opening a U.S. office while continuing to view India as its largest market.

item.title: Best Microsoft Surface Laptop (2026): Which Model to Buy or Avoid
item.description: Surface Pro or Surface Laptop? Here's how to decide which Microsoft device is right for you.

item.title: The Minneapolis tech community holds strong during ‘tense and difficult time’
item.description: Founders and investors in the Minneapolis tech industry told TechCrunch they've put much of their work on hold to help out their community.

item.title: Homeland Security is trying to force tech companies to hand over data about Trump critics
item.description: The use of administrative subpoenas, which are not subject to judicial oversight, are used to demand a wealth of information from tech companies, incl...

item.title: YC startups can now receive investment in stablecoin
item.description: All startups accepted into YC will soon have the option to receive their seed checks via stablecoins.
